sentences.en: A good general tries to anticipate the enemy's movements.
sentences.cn: 优秀将军常常尽量预知敌军的行动.

sentences.en: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.cn: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.en: A reporter asks the president the question on everyone's lips: "Do you anticipate being re-appointed?"
sentences.cn: 一名记者向总裁提了大家都想问的问题：“您觉得自己会再获任命吗？”

sentences.en: But he did not anticipate needing any weapon.
sentences.cn: 但是,照他的预计,并不需要什么武器.

sentences.en: Copernicus anticipated in part the discoveries of the 17th and 18th centuries.
sentences.cn: 17和18世纪的发现中有一部分早为哥白尼所发现。

sentences.en: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.cn: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

sentences.en: Do not anticipate your earnings by spending a lot of money.
sentences.cn: 不要花很多钱而把你的薪水过早用掉.

sentences.en: Do you expect your partner to anticipate your needs?
sentences.cn: 你是否期望你的伴侣不等你提出就主动满足你的需要？

sentences.en: He tried to anticipate all my needs.
sentences.cn: 他设法将我需要的东西预先准备好.

sentences.en: I anticipate his arrival at four o'clock.
It has been impossible to anticipate the amount of bile drainage.
sentences.cn: 预计胆汁的引流量是不可能的.

sentences.en: It is impossible for the bank to anticipate payment.
No employees of the firm are allowed to anticipate their salary.
sentences.cn: 这家商行不允许雇员提前支用薪金.

sentences.en: Officials anticipate that rivalry between leaders of the various drug factions could erupt into full scale war.
sentences.cn: 官员们预计各个毒品团伙头目之间的对抗可能会引发一场全面的冲突。

sentences.en: Our common sense enables us to anticipate part of its analysis.
sentences.cn: 常识使得我们能够预料到这种分析的一部分.

sentences.en: So he folded his hands and waited -- for what, he could not anticipate.
sentences.cn: 因此,他就十指交叉地等待着 -- 等待什么呢, 他也无法预料.

sentences.en: Try to anticipate what your child will do and forestall problems.
sentences.cn: 尽量预见你的孩子会干什么，并预先阻止问题发生。

sentences.en: We don't anticipate any major problems.
sentences.cn: 我们预料不会发生什么大问题。

words.tran_cn: 预期的；提早发生的；期待着的
希望；预感；先发制人；预支

trans.tran_en: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

trans.tran_cn: 预料， 预期， 期望； 先于…行动； 提前使用
trans.tran_en: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it
